alert.note: Alert for Niobrara County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 11 at 4:41PM MST until January 15 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... Snow has ended near the Wyoming and Nebraska border late this afternoon and will taper to snow flurries around Chadron and Alliance over the next few hours. Therefore, will allow the Winter Weather Advisory to expire at 5 PM MST. Wind Chill Warning remains in effect starting late Friday afternoon as a much colder arctic airmass moves into the plains by Friday night. Wind Chill Temperatures are forecast to drop to 45 below zero by late Friday night.
info.instruction: The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. A Wind Chill Warning means the combination of very cold air and strong winds will create dangerously low wind chill values. This will result in frostbite and lead to hypothermia or death if precautions are not taken.
